Package usecases

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • usecases.Player
  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which represents a player that plays implementations of Game. Each player contains a hand, which is the cards the player holds at a given moment. Player methods are used to interact with a player's hand, and to access a players usernames.

      • removeFromHand

        public void removeFromHand​(Card card)
        removes a card that is present in the hand. assumes that the card to be removed is in hand
        Parameters:
        card - a card object to be removed from hand; assumes that card is in hand

      • removeFromHand

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> removeFromHand​(java.lang.String rank)
        remove and return a list of cards with the given rank from this player's hand.
        Parameters:
        rank - the rank of the cards.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of cards with the given rank that have been removed from this player's hand.

      • getSortedHandString

        public java.lang.String getSortedHandString​(java.util.Comparator<Card> c)
        Returns the player's sorted hand as a string with respect to the Comparator implementation c.
        Parameters:
        c - A comparator implementation for Card, this describes how you want to sort the cards.
        Returns:
        The sorted version of the players hand as a string
